Research Papers on Autonomous Agents, Computer Vision, and AI Systems

James F. Mullen et al. published a dataset called "Don't Forget to Put the Milk Back!" for enabling embodied agents to detect anomalous situations.
The dataset was published in IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters in 2024.
The paper is focused on improving agent detection of unusual scenarios.

Kaiming He et al. proposed deep residual learning for image recognition.
The research was presented at the IEEE conference on computer vision and pattern recognition in 2016.
The paper introduced a novel approach to image recognition using deep learning techniques.

Alex H Lang et al. developed PointPillars, a fast encoder for object detection from point clouds.
The work was presented at the IEEE/CVF conference on computer vision and pattern recognition in 2019.
PointPillars provides an efficient method for detecting objects in point cloud data.

Alexey Dosovitskiy introduced a transformer-based approach for image recognition at scale.
The research suggests that an image can be represented as 16x16 words.
The paper was published as an arXiv preprint in 2020.

Zhiqi Li et al. proposed BEVFormer, a method for learning bird's-eye-view representation from multi-camera images.
The research used spatiotemporal transformers for this representation.
The paper was presented at the European conference on computer vision in 2022.

Siyu Teng et al. conducted a comprehensive review of motion planning for autonomous driving.
The paper was published in IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Vehicles in 2023.
The research explores the current state and future perspectives of autonomous driving motion planning.

OpenAI published the GPT-4V(ision) System Card in 2023.
The document provides details about the multimodal vision-language capabilities of GPT-4.

Bo Li et al. introduced LLaVA-OneVision, a method for easy visual task transfer.
The research was published as an arXiv preprint in 2024.

Yihan Hu et al. presented a planning-oriented approach to autonomous driving.
The research was published in the IEEE/CVF Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition in 2023.
